title: Human Resources Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at NSU (Nova Southeastern University)
Interview Descriptions: Unstructured, began with initial call with wrong process and timeline explained. Moved to 2 panel interviews with 7 and 5 interviews at the same time without information on them prior to the interview . Feedback in 2 months from the start of the process. Complete lack of diversity in panel and relativity of questions to the role
Interview Questions: Why would we hire you What is your slogan

title: Enrollment Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NSU (Nova Southeastern University)
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview with scripted questions asked around the table. Know your SMART story and everything else is straightforward. A little distracting when all panel members write notes after each response, which can lead to a little awkward moments.
Interview Questions: Are you comfortable working in a diverse environment? What are your strengths and weaknesses? How do you manage competing priorities when you are working with strict deadlines?

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at NSU (Nova Southeastern University) (Fort Lauderdale, FL) in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: It was a good interview process and I would recommend anybody looking for a steady Monday through Friday 9 to 5 job go and check it out. There was a search committee process so I met with a number of people, and there was a telephone interview and on campus interview.
Interview Questions: They ask the basic interview questions such as what are your strengths and weaknesses, what are your long and short term goals,

title: Admissions Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NSU (Nova Southeastern University) (Davie, FL) in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: It was a basic and easy interview. They asked basic questions. minimal star format questions were given. many were asked about previous experience and just to get an idea of who I am as a person
Interview Questions: Why should we hire you

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at NSU (Nova Southeastern University)
Interview Descriptions: Very laid back. The people who interviewed me are familiar with the position and know what they are doing. Was one on two. style. Would have one person ask questions then the next person would.
Interview Questions: How do you plan on using your past experience to improve NSU?

title: Accountant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at NSU (Nova Southeastern University)
Interview Descriptions: Great interview, the interviewer was very informative about the role and asked great questions. Where do you see yourself in 5 years. Why do you want to work here and asked about experience
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here

title: Assistant Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NSU (Nova Southeastern University)
Interview Descriptions: They have an intensive yet fair interview process. I would definitely look at the NSU pillars and understand the values prior to entering the interview. Overall, I enjoyed the process of the interview rounds.
Interview Questions: What is your 6 month plan?

title: Director of Events Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at NSU (Nova Southeastern University) (Davie, FL) in Dec 2021
Interview Descriptions: Online application and 2 zoom interviews. Met with the direct report and department head. Very enjoyable and pleasant conversation. Found out I was in the top 2 of applicants. Ultimately I was not selected for one lack of experience but I was definitely a favorite.
Interview Questions: Number of years of experience in the role?

title: Patient Management Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at NSU (Nova Southeastern University)
Interview Descriptions: Received a phone call then did a face to face interview and got called the next day. It was a quick interview process, great experience thanks to the hiring managers.
Interview Questions: They asked about your strengths and weaknesses

title: Student Services Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at NSU (Nova Southeastern University)
Interview Descriptions: Interview before a Hiring Committee with preselected HR approved questions. It’s unnerving at times during the interview when the committee members read their question from the page and then after your response, all heads are down while committee members take notes. Standard interview questions that you can easily prepare for beforehand. Hiring process can take weeks before an official start date to begin work.
Interview Questions: Describe a difficult situation and how you overcame it.

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at NSU (Nova Southeastern University) (Fort Lauderdale, FL) in Oct 2021
Interview Descriptions: Professional, easy going. I would say that they were looking for someone to fill the position fast. Impressed with the casual-ness of the interview. Felt pretty nervous but was put at ease when I found I was hired.
Interview Questions: How to find an ip address

title: Assistant Director of Graduate Admissions Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at NSU (Nova Southeastern University) (Fort Lauderdale, FL) in Oct 2021
Interview Descriptions: In all honesty, this was one of the most smooth interview processes I have ever experienced. I was contacted for an interview and given a couple of days to prepare. I was provided with a general idea of the format for the interview. The interviewers were very courteous and actively listened to what I had to say about my experience and my credentials.  I was shortly contacted via phone for a second interview, in which I was also given a heads-up on what the interview would entail and given plenty of time to prepare. I was kept updated by the direct supervisor for the position about my application and was offered the position within a week of my second interview. The direct supervisor ensured me that if I had additional questions to contact them and they replied quickly. In the case they needed to ask another individual, they gave and kept a time frame in which they would get back to me.
Interview Questions: They ask about your experience and credentials. As well as why you want to work for NSU and why did you select that position.

title: Operations Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NSU (Nova Southeastern University)
Interview Descriptions: I met with a panel of five employees and it was a sort of round table interview. This is a common practice in higher education and it was standard. The interview lasted about 45 minutes.
Interview Questions: Questions were behavioral and/or referenced past experience

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at NSU (Nova Southeastern University)
Interview Descriptions: Very engaging and friendly, fast responses and turnaround. Great personalities all around for this graduate assistantship with the office I applied to, and they made their opportunities for growth very clear throughout the conversation as well.
Interview Questions: What did you choose to work at NSU and this office?

title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NSU (Nova Southeastern University) (Davie, FL) in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions: If they're interested they will contact you to schedule an initial phone interview. Then they will tell you that a zoom interview would be scheduled if they're interested in proceeding forward
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at NSU

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at NSU (Nova Southeastern University) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: Slightly informal over zoom. 3 people. Interviewers talked over each other. Didn't feel like they had standardized questions. It was more of a "let's get to know each other feeling."
Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself
Tell me a time when you accomplished something major at work.

title: Student Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at NSU (Nova Southeastern University)
Interview Descriptions: Very brief. they ask you what you bring to the table. They ask you what you want out of the job. How do you help the professors and students.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself and why this job

title: Student Activities Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at NSU (Nova Southeastern University)
Interview Descriptions: Very straight forward. Asked what you would like out of the position. Asked what skills you have to succeed. Asked strengths and weaknesses that you may have in the workplace.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weaknesses

title: Front Desk Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at NSU (Nova Southeastern University)
Interview Descriptions: Very brief, wanted to know about past experiences. Very nice people. HR followed up not to long after and I got the job. They also want to see you have relevant experience and respectful. Dress well, come prepared and you will do well.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your experience

title: Student Front Office Staff Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at NSU (Nova Southeastern University) (Fort Lauderdale, FL) in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: It was brief and to the point and they asked basic questions. The person interviewing me was very kind and was being very informative of the job.  The scheduling for the job was very easy and they worked with my schedule
Interview Questions: what is your biggest deficit for this job?

title: Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NSU (Nova Southeastern University) (Fort Lauderdale, FL) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: There were three levels of interviews.  The first one was with the manager and a team member, the second with the project team, and the last one was with the CTO
Interview Questions: Tell me about a challenge you have had managing requirements and how you dealt with it.

title: SI Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at NSU (Nova Southeastern University) (Fort Lauderdale, FL) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: There was a brief group activity and then the SI leaders split into groups to interview 2 people at once. It wasn't too bad but I felt that it could've been better.
Interview Questions: Think of a time you had a challenge and how you coped with it.

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at NSU (Nova Southeastern University)
Interview Descriptions: online and interview - coming to the university and going over the cv. I dont remember it was 2 years ago. they had the dean with two different interviewers. they ask why me? what is my academic background and how can I contribute the students at the university.
Interview Questions: what is your background

title: Student Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at NSU (Nova Southeastern University)
Interview Descriptions: Interview was pretty good and easy. Even interviewers was friend. Actually they arranged this interview with breakfast. So the environment was very friendly. This process just took a week and got offer letter via email.
Interview Questions: What's your future plans?

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NSU (Nova Southeastern University) (Fort Lauderdale, FL) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: They will conduct the first interview thru the phone to see if you are a good fit for the department requirements. Make sure to study and review your resume since they will ask a lot of question about whatever you did.
Interview Questions: Why you are leaving your old company

title: Temporary Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NSU (Nova Southeastern University)
Interview Descriptions: Applied online for the role and was invited to go in for an interview. The lady who interviewed me was friendly, we had a good talk about the role and how we see that I could be a good fit. She said she has one more interview the following Monday and would let me know of her decision that afternoon. Well, she never called/emailed, just nothing. I understand that work can be  overwhelming at times, but when someone makes an effort to go in for an interview, it's considered common decency to let them know of the outcome, even if their application wasn't successful. At least let them know so they can move on to the next opportunity.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at Nova?

title: Administrative Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NSU (Nova Southeastern University) (Fort Lauderdale, FL) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: It felt more like a conversation than an interview with the person I was interviewing with. I was a little nervous but he was extremely down to earth and made the process very easy.
Interview Questions:
Experience working in the field
What was something that I didn't like doing
How I manage multiple tasks

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at NSU (Nova Southeastern University) (Fort Lauderdale, FL)
Interview Descriptions: Easy Going process Just make sure u know what you have written on Resume because most of the questions asked will be based on the Resume only. Dress in formal and go there are lot of building so go one day ahead and check out where to go. They don't like late comers for interview so don't be late.
Interview Questions: Hobbies

title: Administrative Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at NSU (Nova Southeastern University) (Davie, FL) in Jul 2018
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, days later received call to schedule an interview. Arrived at the time agreed upon. There were several other people also waiting to be interviewed. Last around 15-20 min.
Interview Questions: Background/experience/why work here/strengths

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at NSU (Nova Southeastern University) (Davie, FL) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: 20 minutes phone interview and one-day campus interview. The campus interview includes a teaching demonstration, a meeting with Dean, a research talk and a campus tour. Also, there will be a 30 minutes interview process with the searching committee and  HR.
Interview Questions: why would you like to work in NSU

title: Teachers Aide Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at NSU (Nova Southeastern University) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: No interview needed. Just pick the professor you like and ask to be their aide and chances are they’ll say yes and you just have to submit the paperwork and you’re done.
Interview Questions: They just asked if you can fit this into your schedule

title: Finance Director Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at NSU (Nova Southeastern University) (Davie, FL) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: In addition to submit resume, phone interview and 2 rounds of in -person interview, at least. Interview is usually an hour and efficient. Interview questions are background, education, work experiences and many others.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Administrative Assistant I Student Affairs Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at NSU (Nova Southeastern University) (Davie, FL) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: The initial interview was a 30min phone interview with 2 Deans followed by 1hr 30min in person interview 30min with department directors, 30min with one Dean and 30min with another Dean. I am still awaiting a job offer.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for NSU and why should we hire you

title: QA Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at NSU (Nova Southeastern University) (Davie, FL) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: I had a phone interview then in person. Just standard questions about scrum, previous job experience, automation experience, how was your QA process?, do you have istqb certification? what are your testing methods?  etc. Not any gotcha type questions.
Interview Questions: What are your experience in Scrum ?

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at NSU (Nova Southeastern University) (Fort Lauderdale, FL) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview for the customer service position was simple.  I applied on the company site and received call back a few weeks later. They then ask me a few questions about my background and they explain what the position. They then ask for me to come in for a interview.
Interview Questions: At the interview I first sat with about 4 managers from the department. They ask about my experiences that qualified me for the position and why I feel I should be hired.  They also wanted to know the systems I used at my previous position.  They then had me sit with the directors for the department who ask me similar questions as the managers for about 5 minutes.

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at NSU (Nova Southeastern University) (Davie, FL) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, received an email within 5 days. There was an interview weekend, you were given a list of departments you would interview with. Saturday was interview day, one group interview and the rest one on one or with multiple people from the department.
Interview Questions: What is your greatest achievement?

title: Benefits Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at NSU (Nova Southeastern University) (Davie, FL) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: Online application. Called in for interview with Supervisor.  Non stressful interview.  It was a short but informative interview.  I got fingerprinted and credit check .  Awaited for results and started working.
Interview Questions: Was I willing to learn a new field?  Was I able to work a heavy work load and at times have to stay after work to finish the day's work list.

title: Shark Preview Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at NSU (Nova Southeastern University) (Fort Lauderdale, FL) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: Open and comfortable setting. Dress professionally but still relaxed and comfortable. Formal interview yet relaxed. Not intimidating at all. A week after the interview they called about the job offer (quick response time).
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be a shark preview leader?

title: Fulfillment Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at NSU (Nova Southeastern University) (Fort Lauderdale, FL) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: The fair interview process, easy questions and there were a group of people who interviewed me for 2 positions. Everyone in the interview was very nice, they told me they would call me back within the week to let me know if I would get the job.
Interview Questions: What is one of the biggest challenges you have faced?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at NSU (Nova Southeastern University)
Interview Descriptions: The time between applying & speaking with Manager on the phone to discuss scheduling an interview as short. However, it took 5 months to schedule an actual interview. Single interview with a panel of reviewers. My manager-to-be was not in person, but on a video conference. In total, there were about 7 reviewers in the panel interview. Asked basic questions and probed more responses about my intentions with NSU.
Interview Questions: How to handle getting multiple tasks at once. My weaknesses

title: Administrative Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at NSU (Nova Southeastern University) (Davie, FL) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: Was very friendly and warm however concentrated on talking about things other than finding out about my skills and background. Told me about the position but was not informative of what exactly was expected of me or how the office is run.
Interview Questions: Do you have any computer skills?

title: Visual Architect Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at NSU (Nova Southeastern University) (Fort Lauderdale, FL) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was comprehensive but only over the phone interview. Later on I found out it was not meant to be permanent, although it was hyped as such. Would have been happy to stay working there but soon found out friends are picked over merit.
Interview Questions: Whether I was knowledgeable in human-centered design.

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at NSU (Nova Southeastern University) (Davie, FL) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was harmless, very interesting, knowledgeable and motivating. The interviewer was kind and polite and meant well. It was a good interview but also a way of knowing different characters.
Interview Questions: what is one of my goal and aspiration

title: Assistant Director, Admissions Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at NSU (Nova Southeastern University) (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions:
Round 1: Skype Interview with 4 people
Round 2: Presentation and Committee Interview
Round 3: Interview with Dean/VP

Great communication and updates throughout the process. Moved fairly quickly from one round to the next. Decisions were made quickly.
Interview Questions: Strengths? Why NSU? Enrollment history?

title: Associate Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at NSU (Nova Southeastern University) (Fort Lauderdale, FL) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Professional, easy, friendly, answered my questions about the opportunities and expectations, not much room for negotiations in salary and benefits, strict on salary and low salary offers, felt more top down management structure
Interview Questions: what are your strengths and weaknesses

title: Phonathon Caller Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at NSU (Nova Southeastern University) (Davie, FL) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: The first interview was over the phone after this was a group interview. Both of them were okay. They asked more general questions through the phone. In the group interview, we were asked more question regarding the job description.
Interview Questions: How would you ask an alumnus for a donation?

title: Acct Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at NSU (Nova Southeastern University) (Davie, FL) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: They did not seem engaged in the interview. It was more personal than actually what my experience or skills were. This was not a good look maybe it's a good thing I did Not get the job.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this job.

title: Trainer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at NSU (Nova Southeastern University) (Fort Lauderdale, FL) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: 3 months after applying on line, received a phone call to schedule a phone panel interview.  Had the interview with 5 panel members who took turns asking job related questions in STAR format.  A week later received another call to schedule a face to face with the same panel and was asked to prepare a 15 minutes presentation on a set topic.  My references were contacted at this point.  Presentation went great as well as interview, this time only behavioral questions.  After that, and to my surprise, I was asked to go into another interview with hiring manager mostly about background and experience.  Then, I was handed a psychological test and had yet another interview with another manager.  I was not prepared for this and I guess it showed during the last interview where I had lost most of my enthusiasm.  2 weeks later the status of the position changed to filled and a week later received a letter saying I didn't make it.
Interview Questions:
What is the largest audience you have trained?
Tell me about a time where you went above and beyond?
Tell me about a time were you exceed a customer's expectations?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at NSU (Nova Southeastern University) (Fort Lauderdale, FL) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was brief and interesting because I knew what I was applying for and the interviewer was quick to the point. Although I was over qualified it was all the same an interesting process as i was able to show my benefit to the office if they hired me. The key was takng to my strenghts into a posiiton where it woud overwhelm the requirmeents.
Interview Questions: What can you add to your specified job description

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at NSU (Nova Southeastern University)
Interview Descriptions: Very Casual. Phone interview with three people and then in person interview with the same three people.The interviewers made me feel very comfortable. After the interview they walk me around the call center area.
Interview Questions:
Phone Interview:
What is your customer service philosophy?
Tell me about a time you worked on a group project without support for your team members and how did you handle it?

In person Interview:
Tell me about a time you had a difficult customer and how did you handle it?
Why should we select you?
Tell me about a time you handled a situation without the presence of a supervisor?
Tell me about a time when you received constructive criticism?
Tell me about a time when you helped a coworker?
Tell me abou a time you had to work with a supervisor that had a different work style?

title: Accounting Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at NSU (Nova Southeastern University) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Thorough questions about your accounting related experience, HOW WELL ARE YOUR EXCEL SKILLS, how long have you been in the accounting field, how is your work ethic and communication style.
Interview Questions: How is your Attention to detail?

title: Adjunct Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at NSU (Nova Southeastern University) (Fort Lauderdale, FL) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: There was no interview process. If you meet the criteria of the job and are available to teach (and preferably, you have an inside connection), they offer you a. class.
Interview Questions: Are you available to teach this class?

title: Admissions Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NSU (Nova Southeastern University) (Davie, FL) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: I had 2 interviews.The first was a phone interview with a panel of maybe 5. They asked Situational questions. The second interview was a week later with panel of 7. When called for the 2nd interview, an email was sent after with instructions to prepare  presentation on a program. I liked the fact that they all presented human skills and were all very professional. I felt very comfortable and at home there immediately and throughout the interview. The panel was followed by an interview with hiring manager. They asked all the questions you would expect them to ask in an interview.
Interview Questions: What skills in your current job would you able to use in the position applied for based on job description?

title: Associate Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at NSU (Nova Southeastern University)
Interview Descriptions:
There is a Search Committee who schedule the interview and run the interview. It is about a morning and afternoon schedule, having in between the lunch presentation.
The interview was scheduled on a Friday, with the possibility to spend the whole weekend in Fort Lauderdale.
Interview Questions: Nothing special, all are related to the profession

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at NSU (Nova Southeastern University)
Interview Descriptions: I initially heard found out about the job opening from a friend, so I went ahead and sent over my CV along with a cover letter. Via email I was asked to come for an interview. The interview process was fairly easy. I questions that were typically asked like why do I want to work there. After the interview it took about 2 weeks to be notified that I got the position. The office was very lively, the people were friendly once they warmed up to a new presence in the office.
Interview Questions: The most outlandish question I received was what kind of appliance I would be if I could chose

title: Research Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at NSU (Nova Southeastern University)
Interview Descriptions:
I first received a phone call from the direct supervisor, expressing interest in having me come in to the office (i would be working from) to conduct an interview. I scheduled the interview for a few days later. The interview was very casual, with the direct supervisor and another project manager. Basic questions were asked about my past research experience. It was an opportunity to get to know my personality. As soon as I left the interview (on my way home), I received a phone call from the direct supervisor asking me to attend an interview at another office location with the Principal Investigators (PI's) of the study. I scheduled that interview for a couple days later.  
The second interview was just as casual as the first. The two PI's along with another research associate participated in the interview. The head PI explained that he just wanted to meet me. They also asked me a few questions about my past research experience. The interview was very short, I was surprised. I felt like they literally just wanted to meet me.
Interview Questions: No difficult questions, just questions about your past experience.

title: Transcript Evaluation Specialist Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at NSU (Nova Southeastern University) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: Applied online. Got a call 4 weeks later to schedule a phone interview. Phone interview had 3-5 people on conference call. Got a call the same day for on-campus interview. Campus is very large and parking difficult. Interviewed with 3 people in a conference room. Did another interview with manager of department. No call back as to whether position had been filled. Checked online and position was updated to filled about 3 weeks later.
Interview Questions: Describe a time where you had to deal with a difficult customer and how did you get through it.

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at NSU (Nova Southeastern University)
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview followed by in-person interview in front of a panel.  Presented themselves well, however, interviewing was coordinated by the receptionist.  I arrived early and was not greeted until 15 minutes after my scheduled start time.
Interview Questions: No difficult questions- it was painless.

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at NSU (Nova Southeastern University) (Davie, FL) in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: Friendly and casual. The entire department was part of the interview process. Each member described what their role was and how my job would overlap with their duties. NSU was very prompt in replying to my application and did not wait very long for an interview.
Interview Questions: How do you overcome conflict in the workplace

title: Adjuct Faculty Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at NSU (Nova Southeastern University)
Interview Descriptions: I prepared a curriculum proposal a year ago but there was little interest at the time.  I continued to talk to different people in the center.  When a need arose that resembled my proposal, one of the people I had pitched to recommended me for the new class.
Interview Questions: It was the perfect situation of employer wanting what you are selling at the opportune time.  It was not a difficult process - but I did have to pass scrutiny by a committee.  I did not know what the expectations and criteria are, so that was nerve-wracking.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NSU (Nova Southeastern University) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: Applied online around March and received a call in May.  Application online was easy to follow to also include your resume. Received call  for the position and was interviewed within a week.  Upfront about job description and expectations.  Very professional and courteous.
Interview Questions: How to handle a difficult customer and how would you resolve the problem/issue.

title: Graphic Artist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at NSU (Nova Southeastern University)
Interview Descriptions: There were two interviews which took place over two month period.  There was a required test to prove your capabilities and computer knowledge.  The interview questions were easy.  The overall hiring process was longer than it needed to be, considering the position.  I was given a fair opportunity to interview the employer as well.
Interview Questions: There were none.  The questions were associated with the field but still very generic.

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at NSU (Nova Southeastern University) (Davie, FL) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: Graduate assistant weekend, interview with multiple offices, meet all other students who are also interviewing for positions, you also meet with the VP of student affairs and all the current graduate assistants
Interview Questions: What do you look for in a supervisor? What is your experience with event planning? How do you deal with conflict/stress?

title: Admissions Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at NSU (Nova Southeastern University) (Fort Lauderdale, FL) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: There were four people on the conference call, all reading each question as is but expecting you to figure out what were they actually asking of you.
Interview Questions: How do I handle working with an employee I don't like.

title: Residential Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at NSU (Nova Southeastern University) (Fort Lauderdale, FL) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: There's a group process, then if you stand out in the group process, there is an individual interview. If you pass the individual interview, then you get an email within a week. A very simple process, just show why you're the best for the job. Or learn about the interests of the higher up and start sucking up early.
Interview Questions: What makes you the best for the job?

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at NSU (Nova Southeastern University)
Interview Descriptions: Usually one or two interviews.  Alot of questions and information exchanged. May meet several members of upper management.  Rarely given a tour or introduced to current working staff.
Interview Questions: What is your greatest weakness

title: Associate Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NSU (Nova Southeastern University) (Davie, FL) in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: The process went quickly as the employer was seeking to have the position filled by the time school started at the end of August.  The process seemed efficient and organized.
Interview Questions: Employer concern about salary expectation.

title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at NSU (Nova Southeastern University) (Fort Lauderdale, FL) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: I received a call to determine if I was still interested in the position and a phone interview was scheduled for later that week.  The day of the phone interview I was asked six questions to determine my skill level and experience.  I received a call within 24hours to schedule and on campus interview where I met with the search committee who conducted the phone interview and was asked an additional six questions.  I received a follow up call to meet with the VP I would be assisting and then received a call with an offer.
Interview Questions: 1.	Tell us about a time you went above and beyond what was expected of you to provide quality executive level support.

title: IT Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at NSU (Nova Southeastern University) (Davie, FL) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: Very relaxing, easy questions nothing tricky. Had a short 1:1 interview and got offered the job a week later. Paper work took some time, other then that it was a good experience.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself, go over resume.

title: Enrollment Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at NSU (Nova Southeastern University) (Fort Lauderdale, FL)
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview, in- person interview with 3 people
Interview Questions: Why do you think students should come to NSU, and how will you convinve them that it is the right choice for them.

title: Student Services Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at NSU (Nova Southeastern University)
Interview Descriptions: Be sure to answer the pre questions truefully. Usually search committee and then panel interview. Must love to work with students and professional.
Interview Questions: Innovation questions

title: Training Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at NSU (Nova Southeastern University) (Davie, FL) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: The first phase is phone interview, if you pass, then you are invited to come in for a second round. Interview questions pretty easy
Interview Questions: none, mostly behavioral questions

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 10 months. I interviewed at NSU (Nova Southeastern University) (Dania Beach, FL) in Oct 2012
Interview Descriptions: They do not interview for the most part, the jobs that are posted are full before they are posted, at least for the vast majority of GRA positions. The interview process is really just volunteering with the lab until they have money to hire you or you prove that you are worth hiring.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Accounting Specialist, Temporary Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at NSU (Nova Southeastern University) (Davie, FL) in Sept 2012
Interview Descriptions: I applied to the position using the NSU job website; submitted application on a Sunday, received phone call requesting interview on Monday, and interviewed on Tuesday.  I arrived at interview 10 minutes early. The interview was with the Manager and Controller. They made me feel very comfortable, it was not nerve wrecking at all. First it was "Tell me about yourself" and then they described the position and daily duties.I followed up with questions to show them I had similar duties/experience at previous position. They told me the starting pay, which was not negotiable and no benefits since it was a temp position; it was rather low but an opportunity to get your foot in the door. The entire interview lasted about 30 minutes. 5 weeks after interview, I received an email that the position had been filled.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at NSU (Nova Southeastern University) (Davie, FL) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: We met once in the location of the office.  First I met with the person I would immediately be working under, then with the person she worked under.  In such time, we talked about ourselves.  They also spoke of what I would be able to do.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself.

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at NSU (Nova Southeastern University) (Davie, FL) in Jul 2012
Interview Descriptions: This is a Federal Work Study position. The interviewer was professional, yet friendly at the same time. He introduced me to staff members, showed me around, and explained everything the position entailed. Overall it was a great experience. Not once did I feel nervous or uncomfortable.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself.

title: Network Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at NSU (Nova Southeastern University) (Davie, FL) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions:
The interview was two stage process:

I met with a panel which included the person I would report to, a c-level exec I would work closely with and two peers. After the interview process I was given a technical test to gauge my technical knowledge. 

The second interview I met with the Deans of the colleges I would be supporting.
Interview Questions: If a problem occurs and your boss isn't around to get approval, do you make a immediate decision and beg for forgiveness later if things go wrong, or wait until you can speak with your boss.

title: Administrative and Support Services Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at NSU (Nova Southeastern University) (Davie, FL) in Aug 2011
Interview Descriptions: I applied online via the university website. Several days later, I received a phone call to come in for an interview. I was interviewed by one of Nova's HR Consultants. They congratulated me on getting the interview because they were picking only the best applicants to come in and they had a high number of applicants apply for the position. It was an experienced based interview (behavioral). Took about 50 minutes. Very thorough. I would recommend going through the requirements listed on the job posting and turning the job requirements into questions (tell me about a time where you X, Y, Z // what would you do if X, Y, Z). Interviewer was very thorough and professional. I think I did well, but have a feeling that institutions such as Nova usually go for internal candidates / students / recent graduates.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when your work product was criticized.

title: Client Records Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at NSU (Nova Southeastern University) (Fort Lauderdale, FL) in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions: This interview was an in-person interview, by meeting with the office manager. As this was a one on one interview the process was easy and provided a great opportunity to get a feel of the supervisor. The supervisor was also opened to answer any questions I had in regards to growth opportunity, company/office culture, and a typical day in the life of session.
Interview Questions: Q: What was your experience in customer service?

title: Service Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NSU (Nova Southeastern University) (Davie, FL) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions:
The hiring process was standard. I had  one on one interview followed by a group panel interview ( 3 person).
The environment was professionals with varying questions ranging from personality traits, working in a team to skill level.
Interview Questions: What's your professional goal ?

title: Adjunct Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at NSU (Nova Southeastern University) (Fort Lauderdale, FL) in Dec 2010
Interview Descriptions: I was known to the Department Chair so I did not go through a standard interview process.
Interview Questions: I was simply asked to deliver a one hour segment to a graduate class with the Department Chair in attendance.

title: Assistant Manager, Museum Store Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NSU (Nova Southeastern University) (Fort Lauderdale, FL) in Sept 2010
Interview Descriptions: I sent many resumes before finally getting an interview. I sent about 1 resume per month for 6 months. I got a call for an interview, talked to the owner of the museum stores' merchandise & learned that its a separate company that operates the store & owns the store merchandise, although I would be considered an employee of the museum. When summer came, during my 1st year of work there, I was laid off for the "end of season. The 2nd year, I was not laid off over the summer, I was laid off again for the 3rd summer & decided not to go back when they called again. During that 3rd year, everything changed. Nova Southeast University took over the museum. Not a bad thing. There was always a bit of a "disconnect" between the office people upstairs & the associates who work with the public, and it seemed to get worse when NSU took over. There were basically 3 tiers of workers, 100k plus per year, 35k plus per year & the hourly employees. The hourly employees are the ones that actually do the work, the 35k-ers act like they are your friend, then stab you in the back every chance they get, and the 3 100k plus-ers act like the hourly employees don't exist. I was just there because I love art & i have a ton of retail experience. The work was easy, fast paced(during show openings), met a lot of celebrities & interesting people! The office drama became too much for me, that's why I decided not to go back. Most of the people there are great, the few that are not ruin it for everyone...
Interview Questions: Talk about a difficult customer. What was the problem? How did you handle the situation?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at NSU (Nova Southeastern University) (Fort Myers, FL) in Jun 2010
Interview Descriptions: I applied on line. Was called 3 weeks later for an interview. The interview consisted of a panel of 6 people. The position was for a ten dollar an hour reception/assistant. It was a very involved interview for the position it was offering. After preparing for the interview from sites like Career Builder. com and reading countless interview tips. During the interview I was never asked one question, which I had prepared for. All the questions centered around personalities of people, which I was not prepared for.
Interview Questions: What personality is the hardest to work with?

title: Accounting Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at NSU (Nova Southeastern University) (Davie, FL) in Feb 2010
Interview Descriptions: Only one interview with the department supervisor and it was about fifteen minutes long, mostly talking about how he ran the place and what he expects from his employees.
Interview Questions: None, really. Barely asked me any questions.

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NSU (Nova Southeastern University) (North Miami Beach, FL) in Dec 2009
Interview Descriptions: Executive Director of the department, Director of the Department, HR Represenatives.
Interview Questions: what would you consider your weaknesses

title: GA Fianiad Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at NSU (Nova Southeastern University) (Davie, FL) in Jun 2009
Interview Descriptions:
1 Phone interview
2 Office visit/interview
3. Offer.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself?

title: Computer Support Specialist Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 days. I interviewed at NSU (Nova Southeastern University) (Davie, FL) in May 2009
Interview Descriptions:
I got a call from the Director of the department and asked me about my experience, and the reason I am looking for a job. Afterwards they asked me to come in and do another interview. 

Scheduling was an easy process, and pleasant. When I came in, I was in an office interviewing with the director and the manager of the department. They questioned me with basic troubleshooting questions, and general practices for computer support. I was also asked about my certifications and some of the questions frequently asked on them (A+, Net+, MCP). They also quizzed me with several situational questions.

They decided to bring me back on a later date to do a second round of interviews. This time it was 1:1 with the head guy in charge of the IT department. This time it was more of a "how will you fit in" assessment. Since the ability to try and make relationships with people on the job is a vital, they wanted to make sure that I wasn't some sort of crazy person or anything. 

After 2 more days, I got the call offering me the position.
Interview Questions: How to create a user in Active Directory?
